Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable rooms, best fitness center of any hotel I have stayed in EVER.”
Reviews.Author: Emiliano-peakwell
Reviews.Content: My top criteria when travelling on business is to find a hotel that is relatively new, is no more than 20 minutes away from where I need to be (via metro or taxi, depending on the city and the quality of public transportation) AND a fully equipped gym so that I can keep to my 90 minute daily cardio, weight and ab work-out. Centrovital met these criteria 110%. The fitness center is a membership gym but connected to the hotel and guests can use it free of charge. Of the 100s of hotels I have stayed in, this gym ranks at the very top. Top of the line equipment, 20 meter pool, trainers to assist...just fantastic. The hotel is new, the rooms small but clean and functional (would suggest an upgrade to the TVs, time to go flat screen). Located on the shores of a small lake and close to a charming small town. 20 minute, 20 Euro cab ride to downtown Berlin. This is my choice hotel for all future Berlin visits.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with good facilities”
Reviews.Author: PRGirlLondon
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at this hotel - our company uses it for business. The rooms are a good size and the beds comfortable. There is wireless in the room. The bathrooms are an okay size. The staff are always helpful. There is a spa/swimming pool which I haven't used, but my colleagues reported as good. Breakfast is good with a wide variety of hot and cold choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great spa location that has fairly easy access to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: christinamn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November 2011 as part of a spa getaway with my Mom and cousin. I found the hotel to be quite nice - the rooms were comfortable...not the luxury you often find in an American hotel of this class, but very up to the more austere European standards. My mom and I shared a "double" room - which turned out to be identical in every way to my cousin's single room. As is typical in Europe, the bed is just two smaller beds pushed together. So we just pushed the two beds apart. We found all the staff to be friendly and helpful - including front desk, workout area and spa. I really loved the "wellness" area of the hotel. There is a great pool - kept at a nice temperature. And the sauna is awesome. Of course, it's co-ed and nude...so I expect many Americans will be uncomfortable with that. But just relax and enjoy the experience. I was in the sauna during the morning when one of the staff members came in with some water with menthol. He went through a whole routine of adding the menthol steam and then spreading it through the sauna room by spinning a towel above his head. It was amazing. There is also a full size gym area - with plenty of cardio and weight lifting equipment. We also all had a spa service. My mom and cousin and loved their massage. I thought mine was pleasant, although I had hoped for something a little more deep tissue. Probably my fault for requesting the wrong service. One thing I'll warn you about. If your primarily goal is to spend time in Berlin, this isn't the hotel for you. While there is easy access to a S-Bahn (train) into Berlin...it's a quick bus ride or pleasant walk to the station...it's still a bit of a trip to get all the way in since the hotel is at the end of the line. But, if you want a place to relax AND have some fun in the city. Then this is great. Also, amazing breakfast buffet. Full spectrum of hot and cold food - including omelet made to order. Just so you are aware - the price for the buffet was included the quoted cost of our hotel room, although the cost was separated in the final bill since there is a different level of tax for rooms and food. Turns out, the difference in price between our double room and my cousin's single room was exactly the cost of the second breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel... Exellent fitnesscenter og breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: dkfals
Reviews.Content: Stayed on this hotel for 3 days, attending the U2 koncert. The fitnesscenter is simply amazing og very large. Only used the pool once and found out everybody, men and women, where naked in the saunas :-) The breakfast buffet is very nice with lots of healty food. We had our 2 small dog with us and only paid a small extra fee. Parking was a bit expencive, as for the price of the stay. Would certantly come back for another weekend if the price is right

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: 60-degreese-North
Reviews.Content: Back again in this hotel - it really cannot be beaten if you need to be in / around Spandau district. The hotel has a superb spa etc and also has a small cafe / bistro as well as a restaurant. What makes this hotel stand out is the cleanliness, the facilities and the staff - very helpful and pro-active in solving problems.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Spa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura P
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Centrovital Hotel in Spandau Berlin. Location in Spandau is 45 min from Berlin Mitte, but for us that wasn't a problem - great public transportation system ensured smooth travel. The hotel itself was reasonably priced, but still 4 star hotel - very clean, modern and pleasant. Extra points for totally non-smoking hotel (smoking is allowed only outside areas), so allergic persons will love this too. Access to spa area is included to the price, and it was worth going. Breakfast was very good and versatile. Also, thums up for great service!

Reviews.Title: “a tad uncharismatic but excellent spa facilities, and a great choice for a family wedding”
Reviews.Author: CJ_Zanahoria
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 nights before and after a family wedding. first 2 days we were sightseeing in Berlin and while it was a bit of a trek to get to the city centre it was do-able, catch a bus to Spandau Arcaden and then the S Bahn from there. very helpful reception staff gave us lots of helpful transport info (in perfect English of course!) we were glad of the spa facilities so we could cool off after a hot day's sightseeing, the pool is full 25m long so could do a proper "work-out" swim. there was also a nice jacuzzi area and lots of comfortable loungers. did not use exercise area but it looked very extensive. as is usual in Germany the mixed sex sauna area was a swimwear free zone (something our fellow Brits were a bit uncomfortable with!). the whole area beautifully clean and well organised with great changing areas, showers etc rooms comfortable without being exciting, but was quite surprised there was no (user-controllable) air con. ventilation in bathroom could have been better as the mirrors steamed up very easily. breakfast buffet extensive, but breakfast service a bit patchy with a reasonable wait for coffee to be brought when it was busy at the weekend and waiters looking a bit flustered at times. some of our party was disturbed by the aircraft noise from nearby Tegel and it was very noticeable as we enjoyed wine and tapas on the terrace of the (ok but not special) downstairs bistro bar. and finally the wedding celebration meal and party afterwards was held in one of the private conference rooms, could not fault the polite and hard-working staff or the food which was absolutely excellent. the room was far enough away from the hotel bedrooms so we did not have to worry about making lots of noise till the early hours (which we duly did!) all in all v good value for money for a capital city location

Reviews.Title: “Nice room , excellent reception and customer care in all areas”
Reviews.Author: sexybexyMidlands
Reviews.Content: Had a nice two day break in this hotel.. The only negatives the Non- residents who camp out in the sauna area.. make you feel quite uncomfortable.... Only other mild critisism was on our second day the breakfast room had been very busy and slow to clear tables and top up breakfast items... but all staff were smiley and helpful Over all good base to explore Berlin and surrounding areas... would recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked, no aircondition, bad service”
Reviews.Author: keppu1
Reviews.Content: This hotel might have a nice spa and restaurant, but we would not book here again. We had booked a room at Centrovital on April 20 for the night of Sat 18.7. to 19.7. Our friends later decided to join and booked 3 nights there as well during that time. When we arrived at Centrovital on the 18th around 13h, well before check-in time we were told there was no room for us, since the hotel was full. This was the day of the U2 concert and of course everything else affordable in Berlin was booked as well! The hotel offered us a room in a hotel which was another 15 mintue drive AWAY from the city. Since the hotel is located near the final stop of the subway, this was not an option - plus, we had friends booked at this hotel who did not really want to repack for one night. When we said we would change, but into a hotel closer to town, the hotel said this was impossible. Also they claimed it had been impossible to contact us! We might not have given a phone number in our online booking through www.booking.com but through our booking code it shoudl have been possible to write an email MUCH earlier. When we found a (more expensive) place in town and asked to hotel to change us to that... ALL OF A SUDDEN they did find a room!. This hassle cost us almost an hour and a lot of nerves. We have the feeling that since we booked so early at a cheap rate, that our room was rather given to someone who paid later and full price when Berlin hotels filled up for the concert. This is not right. The hotel gave us some vouchers for their restaurant, but since we were there only one night we of course could not use them. Some more notes to the stay: The hotel does NOT have aircondition! The rooms were awfully hot and with window out to the street cafe, sleeping with open windows was not an option either. Also, the airtraffic is too loud. In the morning, the breakfast room was closed early due to some happening - and guests were told to use the hotels cafe facilities which a were very small. First, there was hardly enough space. Then their coffee machine was broken, and things available upstairs not available here. The staff was clearly not able to handly all the incoming complaints from various tables. All in all this was quite a disappointing experience and I could not recommend this hotel to anyone. We think it was a lame excuse that they could not reach us. Overbooking on a day of a concert of a famous band also does not seem acceptable to me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel Excellent staff totally fulfilled all expectations of a great city break”
Reviews.Author: Searsjohn
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel.Staff were smart,super efficient,curteous,friendly,very helpful and all spoke fluent english.The hotel was spotlessly clean(the pool/spa area you were made to wear a gown and plastic flip-flops which they provided for a small fee).The rooms were a tad small and somewhat clinical but nevertheless clean and extremely functional.Very in keeping with modern day germany i guess. When we stayed here 19 months back(yes this is quite a belated review-just got bit more time on my hands now) we got an excellent 3 night deal including admission to spa/pool facilities.The best i've experienced in a hotel yet.we had swim,jacuzzi,sauna and steam room 1st thing every morning and before dinner in the evening-very refreshing.we went b&b and the breakfast was to die for.A buffet self service,food quality second to none and as much as you want. In the evenings we found a fabulous chinese right opposite the hotel or strolled into spandau centre where we found a couple of good places to eat.Pubs there very lively with quite an atmosphere. the town of spandau took approx 10-15mins and the s-bahn about 20.almost all the top sightseeing places of interest were within easy reach of an s-bahn stop.A great way of exploring Berlin is by bike.When we next visit we certainly will. Please visit Berlin zoo you'll not be dissapointed. I don't want to tempt fate but we never once felt unsafe in Berlin.There seems to be a far greater respect for the law than in britain.Sad but is true i feel. To summarise if you're looking for a break in Berlin Centrovital is your man,away from the hustle n bustle but within easy reach of anywhere you might fancy and ring the hotel direct for the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: le-mailman
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, staff are friendly and helpful. Nice location close to the S & U bahn. Excellent facilities, the spa is well worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Burrenlad
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel with my wife in late September, for a long weekend in Berlin. The hotel is excellent. Vey clean, excellent facilities and the staff were very friendly. It is about ten minutes walk, along by the river into the town of Spandau and a further five minutes to the railway station, which will take you quickly into Berlin City Centre. We went on the Friday night into Spandau town centre, but there was not much nightlife. Very good leisure centre and the food, especially the breakfasts where excellent. I would certainly recfommend this hotel sure and business for both leisure travellers alike.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: AlunWatkins
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out I had a 100% positive experience. The staff I came into contact with at reception, restaurants, spa and housekeeping were first class with an impressive friendliness and efficiency. I had booked a single room which sometimes in Germany is very small but even though it was a genuine single room it was just like the double room photos but with an oversize single bed. Breakfast which was free had an excellent buffet selection with a chef cooking omelets etc. to order. The chef suggested I take my seat while he prepared the omelet and he brought it personally to my table. The Bistro restaurant again had very friendly staff and the food quality and presentation was very good. The spa is top class with a large swimming pool, a children’s pool, a powerful jacuzzi, saunas, steam baths and tropical rainfall showers. I checked out at 11.00am but the spa was available free for the rest of the day. Traveller's tip on saving a few bucks The hotel provides a free pass for local transport and you can use it to catch the bus from within 100 yards of the hotel to the railway station (4 stops) where you can catch a train into Berlin (about 15 minutes to the main shopping centre). Berlin’s integrated transport system is very good and easy to use. The Berliner City Tour on open top bus with Live commentary is very good for 10 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Better than last time!”
Reviews.Author: travellerfromkiev
Reviews.Content: After a good but extremely wet stay in March, we returned for a long weekend over Pentecost. We got a very good deal booking direct with the hotel so splashed out on a junior suite. We were on the 3rd floor on a corner. The suite had the usual bedroom, plus sitting area (TVs in each room) which could be separated completely with sliding doors. As the sitting area had a sofa bed, this would be good for families. Large bathroom with both bath and separate shower as well as 2 basins. All spotless and free mineral water is a nice touch. We were also given a voucher for a free welcome drink. We made full use of the spa/pool area and discovered the rooftop sauna/sunbathing area. Ideal given the very hot weather. This got pretty busy but there was always plenty of space in the pool/saunas. The location is very good - a pleasant stroll into Spandau old town where there are some good bars and restaurants. We liked Bar Altstadt on the pedestrian street on the way in - nice staff, good beer and a little courtyard garden out the back. Thoroughly enjoyed it and will certainly be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: mromero548
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in May 2008. Very nice hotel on the outskirts of Berlin. The spa/sauna area was very relaxing and enjoyable. The staff was excellent. Breakfast was great and provided a great start to our day. After breakfast it was off to the pool area for some relaxation and exercise. The room was sufficient. No air conditioning but the windows opened all the way. No internet access on the 5th floor so we had to take our laptops down to the 4th floor. Not too inconvenient. The Spandau area was fairly quiet. Several restaurants within walking distance. We had our car so travel into central Berlin was easy. Overall, a very nice week.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay”
Reviews.Author: WolfgangEmperger
Reviews.Content: Not really a business hotel but serves the purpose. Nice rooms, decent internet access and business services. Only a few choices around the hotel in walking distance. Has apparently a great spa area, but due to business I had no time to check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Spa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JB246
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Centrovital recently on a weekend trip to Berlin. It's a 15 minute taxi ride from Tegel airport. The rooms are modern and clean. The best thing was included use of the spa facilities in the hotel including - a large swimming pool, multiple steam rooms and saunas, an ice room foot baths. Getting into Berlin to see the tourist sights is simple, Spandau station is an easy 20 minute walk through the town of Spandau.

Reviews.Title: “Bit surprised at all the fantastic reviews (but I didn't use the spa facilities)”
Reviews.Author: pkbpkb
Reviews.Content: I got a very good deal on the Centrovital so, taken with the very good reviews decided to try it out even though it was out west in Berlin. The location wasn't too bad because I was spending my days on business in the west part of centre anyway, so transport wasn't a problem. Check in was an enormous hassle. It took me THREE attempts to get my room key correctly programmed in order to let me in to my room. After a days meetings and then flight to Berlin that was very annoying. I asked at the reception whether they could provide me with a kettle so that I could fill my hot water bottle, as I was going through a period of waking with a sore back. The evening receptionists were not helpful, suggsting that there wasn't a single kettle in the place. I walked through the old town of Spandau to the railway station a couple of times - definitely walking distance. And the old town is quite pretty. Around the hotel it can seem a little hair-raising, but I didn't encounter any trouble. The swimming pool did look very inviting - if I stayed at this hotel again, I would definitely ensure that I was only staying here to use the spa/pool/gym facilities, and perhaps then my review would be a little better. The breakfast was indeed very good - loads of choice.

Reviews.Title: “great value and not too far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: woofweef
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a short break in Berlin and this reasonably new hotel was excellent. It is in Spandau (near the Citadel) and was very good value for money. We reserved directly with the hotel (best price we found). We wanted somewhere which had a pool complex to provide a little change from the hours of sight-seeing! It costs 10 euro per day extra to use the spa facilities but this was definitely worth it - it includes a range of saunas and a gym. The breakfast buffet was excellent too - full range of hot and cold. Although a little out of the centre, Berlin's great public transport system delivered us to the sights quickly and cheaply - get the bus 136 or 236 (every 5 mins) from hotel 4 stops to Spandau Rathaus, then use regional train ("RE") to get to centre in approx 15 minutes. You could use the S Bahn but it takes longer. A one day travel card covering the main zones (and all transport types) is 5.80 euro, although you can also get a group ticket for up to 5 people ( a "Kleingruppenkarte") for 14.80 euro per day. I also agree with what other reviews have said about the staff - they are so friendly, cheerful and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city spa”
Reviews.Author: FLIEGER67
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night´s stay at the Centrovital. This was my second stay there and again it was perfect. Booked for 80.-- EUROs B&B by an internet hotel dealer. Centrovital is located in Berlin-Spandau, about 30 minutes by subway or S-Bahn to the city centre. Spandau is included in the A/B area tourist tickets, so not expensive at all. We had a well designed, clean room with tub, there are also rooms with showers only. A large indoor pool area, 6 different saunas, a roof top terrace during the summer months, 3 restaurants, 1 with direct access from the spa area,only for the spa guests, that means you can sit down to eat in your bathrobe. A wooden fireplace to relax inside the spa area. Perfect and highly recommendable. Next visit is booked for May.

Reviews.Title: “Just book it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just book it. Spent 3 nights here in Oct 2005 with my wife and daughter. The hotel is a bit out from the centre but since my daughter had her car it was no problem. There did appear to be easily available public transport. The hotet was in excellent condition and the bedrooms were very clean and reasonably sized. Toilet/shower room were spotless. We enjoyed an excellent meal in the first floor restaurant(Koch Kunst?)and it was very reasonably priced. Staff were very helpful and friendly. If I go to Berlin again I won't waste time loking up hotels, I'll just book this one again.

Reviews.Title: “great to chill out”
Reviews.Author: tommyefc
Reviews.Content: stayed June 26 to june 29 2005. Lovely hotel in the west of berlin but with easy access to the centre. Three bus stops away from main spandau station and about twenty minute pleasant walk along canal and lakeside from spandau. Excellent quality with spa(10 euros) have a swim in a nice sized pool. One night had a lovely meal on the hotel terrace overlooking lake not budget price although snacks availabe in other bar. meal and drinks for two 50 euros but would be a lot dearer in similar standard hotel in england. Staff were very freindly and helpfull but not in your face. If you want a hotel were you can chill out this would be a good one. (some noise from aircraft which go overhead but did not bother us and they seem to stop at certain time at night.) Room was very good as hotel is only one year old excellent condition. Meals available two minutes away by lake about 20 euros for two. also on main road kebabs etc 5 to 10 euros for two and asia meals within 5 minutes. We had a great time and would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: centrovital Hotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Neuendorfer Strasse 25 | Brauereihof 6, 13585 Berlin, Germany
